content.detailedDescription:
I saw what appeared to be the monolith from 2001 flying through the air very slowly, and with no lights or sound.  it was just after sunset, it was still light out, but getting harder to see.  i was just under the i-435 bridge at the missouri/kansas border on river rd.  i would go to this area to play with my wolf, at the time she was a 6 month old 100% timberwolf.  she began to freak out like something was there, but i could see nothing.  the weird part was she wasn't looking at the woods or grass, but at the road itself, and when i looked i saw nothing there.  my van was parked on the side of the road, so i began to walk her back to the van, but she wouldn't go near the road.  by this time she was getting pretty big, so when she wanted to, she could pull pretty hard.  she kept trying to pull me away from the road, and then she started yelping and shaking and wouldn't go any farther.  i couldn't figure out what was wrong with her, so i just dragged her to the van and put her in.  i then went around to get in the driver's side to go home, and that is when i saw the craft.  i completely forgot about what was bothering my wolf, because this thing was huge, and really far off so i didn't feel threatened at all.  it wasn't until i got home that i began to question what she might have sensed out there on that road.  what i saw was flying so slow, that it didn't make any sense to me.  it looked exactly like a flying monolith, that is the only way i can describe it.  after about 5 minutes, i watched as a much smaller, triangle shaped craft dropped out of the bottom rear of the monolith.  the monolith then sped away in an instant, while the triangle craft headed out over the highway towards kansas.  the smaller craft wobbled as it flew, like a frisbee.  the wobbling wasn't very dramatic, kind of like watching someone drive with an alignment problem.  i've seen this triangle craft before on a discovery channel program, so i know that this was a military craft.  they use some kind of centrifugal force to make tight turns and fly like a frisbee, and that is what this thing did.  the one on the show i watched was the exact same type of craft, except this thing had no lights on.  it's been awhile since i saw the show i'm talking about, but from what i remember, these triangle shaped craft have been verified by our military as being real.  the show had actual footage, not a recreation.  these things can turn on a dime, but can be explained.  what freaked me out was the large monolith craft, because it didn't make any sense.  i've seen a small predator stealth fighter before, here at the kc air show, and i thought that was pretty cool.  this thing beat that, and the fighter was doing flips around a stealth bomber to show off.

i just watched a history channel show about the stephenville tx sightings, and although they don't match what i saw, what bothered me was one of the witnesses.  he said he also had a wolf, and it acted scared as well.  this made me remember how my wolf acted, and got me thinking that although these craft are silent, maybe they emit high-frequency sound the wolves can hear.  kind of like a dog whistle.  the craft was so cool, that i just didn't connect the weird behavior of my wolf to the object until your witness said the same thing happened to his wolf.  it was the old guy with the dark glasses on.

i don't claim to be anything except a startled witness to something strange.  what i saw appeared to be military, although strange, it didn't defy reason.  what i want to know is if maybe a cloaked soldier could have been in the road, and that my wolf could smell him.  this would explain why she freaked out, because she could smell but not see them.  she could also have heard sounds made by the craft that i couldn't, because i never heard a sound from either craft.  i have ocd, so i notice things others don't.  if my wolf hadn't have been freaking out though, i wouldn't even have looked up i don't think.  you guys can either believe me or not, nobody else does.  i don't really care if these craft are military, just if they are alien tech.  i actually support my government, so if there is any conspiracy, i'm on their side if they want to keep their secrets.  i'm the kind of person that wants to know the answers to all the questions, then if the answers need to be kept secret, i wouldn't mind a bit if they shot me in the head after revealing it all to me.
content.summary: 2 ufos. 1 large rectangular, 1 small triangle. silent, no lights.

content.detailedDescription: Late winter, one of the warmer nights we had had, my step-son stepped outside with our dog and soon shouted "come here, quick! you have got to see this!" as i ran outside, i observed my step-son and our dog looking up towards the northeastern sky. as i looked in the direction in which they were looking, i observed a huge craft, unlike any other craft i have seen in all of my time. it was an elongated boomerang shape, light manila in color, this craft appeared to have approximately 5 exhaust ports glowing a light orange-yellow in color....This craft made no sound whatsoever..It was heading in a ssw direction and was soon out of sight. i believe this was a sunday, very few people out and about. i am a firm beleiver this was the same craft observed by police officers in (galesburg?)the same one in illinois that has aired on the history channel. as i first noticed the craft, it was unlike anything i had ever seen before...As i am a ten year veteran of the army and navy, an aircraft buff of sorts,,pretty well versed on the latest jet aircraft in the us arsenal. i knew immediately after seeing this craft, it was something special, unlike anything i had ever seen before. it headed on a ssw direction headed directly for the next town south of us jonesboro, ar) and then was out of sight. this craft appeared to be at least 300 ft cross, maybe 120 ft from front to back and made no sound slicing through the air,,,,none! seconds later it was out of sight..My step son and i knew that we had seen something very unique.
content.summary: Triangular (boomerang) huge & silent , appeared to have exhaust ports.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were sitting on our back patio looking at the stars when a boomerang object came into view from the south east. it was very low to the ground , probably 200 to 300 feet. there was no sound and no lights. the object moved to the north west. there was a kind of heat wave around the object. my wife and i did not say a word to each other. we just looked back and forth wondering if each of us was seeing what we were seeing. even though it was dark, the sky was clear and you could easily see the object. i stated it was a perfect 90 degree angle.I would say if a jet liner was low enough to the ground that the wing span looked about 6 inches across,that is how low it was.It took about 1 to 2 minutes to go across the sky and moved off the the nw. the object looked black against the  night sky. about 2 weeks later we were again sitting on the patio and an object came into view from the south moving very fast and very high in the sky. it had a yellow/golden color and it was the same shape as the first object we saw.It went across the sky very quickly. but, about 2 weeks after that, we saw the same object with the same color coming from the south west higher thanthe last object and this time moving so fast i could just tell it was the same shape. it only took a a few seconds for it to fly over. there is a picture from kaufman county texas that has an object that shape we saw.
content.summary: 90 degree boomerang shape, no lights, no sound, dead slow, very low, wife saw also.

content.detailedDescription:
Walking down the street with a friend and saw 3 orange orbs ,almost turned in to a triangle instantly.It hovered for quite awhile and seperated again i would say 10 minutes , then they seperated for a distance and hovered again we were in shock since we live near an airport and have seen all types of aircraft over the years.It stayed motionless and soundless although its distance was that of a plane landing at green airport (prov airport)it was not far from the airport so someone there had to have seen it. the three orange balls of it  moved in an odd pattern after that and formed a line and moved up ward until they became smaller and dissapeared after about five minutes the hair on my neck was standing up and we were speechless ,i am a sceptic no more. we went to my friends house and called the airport  to report it and they laughed at us! they said

 we saw stars etc. i wish we had a camera because they were so low it would be impossible not to accept as ufo or military ,i belive it was the former i will never foget it as long as l ive! stars and aircraft do not move like that amd they are not orange orbs.
content.summary: 3 orange orbs turned into a triangle.

content.detailedDescription:
Ok, ive told the story a few times, so i can still remember how it happened. i was on a wildland fire hand crew, way up near the canadian border in washington state. the thing i remember most about the area was that is was very steep and heavily wooded. for me personally, the woods there had an air about them that made me feel a little spooked in a peculiar sort of way. i enjoyed it quite a bit. we were there for maybe four or five days, not too sure about that, but the whole time, i felt that way. 
   anyway, we were on the night shift the first night out on the line. it was a long dozer trail that ran sidehill up and down and all over the country. the trail had been freshly cut, and the soil was made of grey pumice, and there were a lot of big rocks just underneath the soil, and therefore littered about the trail, which made it very treacherous to walk at night, especially since we hadn't seen the place in the daylight.
   after a long walk, the division supervisor, or whatever his title was, assigned us to spread out along the trail, 100 feet apart from each other, and hold the line. holding line is just making sure no fire crosses the fireline. well, there was no more fire where we were, so we spread out, moved a few times to adjust our spacing, and the call came down the line to take a rest. our crews position was just a precautionary measure, and another crew would space out beyond our location to secure more fireline. 
we faced the green (the unburned area), as is the practice, and waited. we all had our backs to the ridgeline, which probably rose about 300 feet above our heads, and were all facing the valley below. i could make out the outline and some detail of the ridgeline above and to the right of me in the moonlight. after about 30 minutes, another crew passed behind us on the trail and continued down the line, just as we had done. i noticed that most of them were wearing glowsticks in their hardhats, a safety measure to make it easier to locate one another. 
     well, about 5 minutes later, i glanced up to the ridgeline into the burn area to see if i could see any glow of the fire, (which a firefighter often does) and saw some strange lights. my first thought was that the other crew had somehow made it all the way up to the ridgetop, and that i could see the glowsticks in their hats, but they were behaving in an erratic manner. then i thought that it must be fire, but i could see no orange glow, which is unmistakable in the night to any firefighter. no sparks, no flame. it lacked the hue and color quality of the light of any fire. my last thought was that it must be another crew with glowsticks in their hats up there, but by then, more had appeared, perhaps a dozen, and they all had moved into a direct line of sight, where i could clearly track their movements. i was standing up, viewing at a distance of perhaps 500 yards, and about 60 degrees up. i would judge each one to be about the size of a volleyball. they were swooping among the tree tops just below the leeward ridge top. their movements seemed conscious, as they were interacting kinetically with each other and the trees. they would change directions at probably 20 mph and follow strange twisted paths, kind of like they were dancing. they stayed close together, within a distance of probably 30 yards apart, and all the while changing hues from yellow to green to blue and red. the light seemed to morph a little and had the flicker of plasma, and i knew then that these were not the movements of people, and if they were, they were up climbing the trees and swinging on ropes! if they had been on the ground, the hill would have to be taller, and i would have been able to see the taller trees behind. later viewing in the daytime confirmed this, that the objects were in the treetops.
  i watched the whole thing for the better part of an hour, and wasn't too excited about it at the time, but kept it in the back of my mind. i did notice when they became fewer, and then i finally looked up again and they were all gone.
  an interesting note, i remember it started to get light early, around 5:30 am, and we were still in the same spot. the morning sky was very grey and structured. at around 6:00 am, i thought it unusual to see a lightning storm come from behind the ridgetop above us. i saw the first lightning in the area where i saw the balls of light, though i did not witness any downstrikes, just cloud to cloud. it is quite unusual to have a lightning storm at that time of day, especially in a cool climate. 
   later investigation in the area over the next few days revealed that there was no active fire in the vicinity of the sighting at the time, and that the area was in fact still green. the day after the incident, while taking a break, i spoke up about what i saw, and found that three others had viewed the same thing. we spoke about it for perhaps 1 minute, and that was all that was said. i still know two of them. i do not know if anyone else on our crew saw the lights.
    so in conclusion, i dont know what they were. i put them in my strange file. they may have been atmospheric electrical phenomenon, but the way they were moving was so lifelike, i do not know, and i dont know what to make of the fact that a lightning storm appeared in the same spot, 5 hours after they were gone. take it for what it is, whatever that is!
content.summary: Multicolored plasma balls.

content.detailedDescription:
It was back in 1983 me and my brother in law were on a river at night catfishing we headed back to the boat ramp after fishing the lines, and the boat was loaded with cat fish, it was a dark night no moon no clowds we took our last sharp curve and headed down a stright away and to our left in the top of the pine trees we saw an orange lite, we slowed down or the motor shut off i can't remember but this lite came across the tops of the trees real slow.It seem to take forever to bust out of the trees it look just like a comet with a tail it was as big as a vw car, but it moved so slow and so stright across the river to the other side of the tree tops and not a sound, nothing. it was 150 ft across that river and it took at least 8 sec' for it to cross.Big an long 50ft from front to the back of the tail, it was just the shape of a comet but right at tree top hight and was moving in a stright line, not at an angle. i looked back at my brother in law to ask what that was? all he said was i don't know. and he went to pulling the rope to get the motor started, we never said a word about it to each other and i still am not sure what this was. can anyone shed some lite on this for me. 
                      stacy p. brown
content.summary: This took place in the winter time, not a lot of people on the river. so we had it to our selfs or so we thought!

content.detailedDescription: I was driving down grand river and spotted a vertical object hanging in the sky. it was moving very slowly in a rotating motion, like a dreidel being spun. the object was shaped like an acorn or diamond and there were protrusions sticking out of the sides. i pulled my car over to a parking lot and the object disappeared before i could get a good look at it and take a picture of it on my cellphone. it either faded away or took off very fast.
content.summary: Blue, green, red and violet colored diamond shaped object in sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving in 26 w okeechobee rd, hialeah, fl, united states south in the front passenger sit to miami beach for a work related issue, i was looking an airplane when i saw a cloud in the far south change from white to yellow and back to white... it look interesting so i stay looking when out of no where i started to noticing something, at first i though it was a bird... but it was coming toward my direction, as it get closer i did not notice any winds or anything related to a bird, second though in my mind was a balloon but then balloon do not stay in the same position and moving north, to my knowledge they keep going up and up but this was definitively not going up but north in the same altitude... when it was getting closer it look like a circle metallic object, the bottom part was dark so as the sun was hitting the top side... as i keep looking at the object it looks like it was hovering really low.. i was in a red light so i had some time to look at it, when i decide to tell my friend who was driving the light turn to green and we had to go, my friend try to look at it but he could not see it since he was in the driving sit and could not look up as i did. my heart started pounding really hard, i had no words for 4 to 5 minutes, i was in shock my mouth was open and i did not know what to do but keep looking, when i finally decide to tell my friend i realize that i did not had a camera... my sorry blackberry does not have a camera either so i could not take a picture, i feel so baddd that i could not have take a picture or video for the whole world to see but i think this is going to stay with me for the rest of my life. i am still in shock and wish for a seconds that i had a camera of anything so i could have taken a picture right then and there.

http://maps.Google.Com/?Ie=utf8&ll=25.822801,-80.280764&spn=0.001767,0.004828&z=18&layer=c&cbll=25.822722,-80.280564&panoid=grgneizqe9nksxi4ujaw4a&cbp=11,149.57865974497065,,0,-11.930006242878056

there is the link on the location where i was at the moment of the event

if anyone here in south florida notice the same thing please let me know
content.summary: Round, metallic object.

content.detailedDescription:
I went outside in my back yard to have a cigarette and saw a very bright "star" in the sky almost due west of me.  as i was watching it, it appeared to move back and forth in an unusual way.  i became intrigued and continued to watch it to make sure that it: wasn't an airplane or helicopter, wasn't a satellite or star, and was truly moving strangely [the eyes can play tricks on you if you stare at something too long].

after another 5-10 minutes i could tell that it was definitely not an airplane or a helicopter.  i had my wife come out to double-check me to see if it was truly moving.  she confirmed that it was.

the distance?  very hard to tell.  at one point i watched an airplane fly directly in front of it.  due to this fact, i would surmise that it was out over the ocean.

more about the movement: it moved left and right, up and down and, apparently, farther away and closer [it would grow fainter then brighter].  it would stay in one place for awhile and then move in an intermittent and abrupt manner.  sometimes it would oscillate back and forth or up and down, and sometimes it would zip in one direction and stay there.  it seemed to be heading in a general northwest direction [out over the ocean].  my wife probably best described the movement, "it was like a bug."

it also seemed to sparkle with different colors, red and maybe blue, but this was difficult to confirm.

after approximately 51 minutes, i lost sight of the object as it finally moved low on the horizon and behind a tree.

my feelings and reactions?  well, i am a scientist by training [i have a graduate degree in chemistry] so, while being very intrigued, i tried to be as objective in my observations as possible.  all i can say for sure is that it was a "flying" object that i couldn't identify.

i did take pictures and a short video with my camera but realistically they are of no use.  it just appears as a point of light on a black background.
content.summary: Moving light in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: Watch from my windows y can see a bright light in the sky, something like saturn, but with more lights around.
content.summary: Bright lights, a little point in the center of a circle, the circle are many lights.

content.detailedDescription: I was facing north on my driveway talking on the telephone. it was a clear night, and unseasonably warm for december. in the sky north of benton i saw a orb of light descend quickly towards the ground. it moved at a speed which is unlike i have ever seen any typical aircraft. the light was a solid bright yellow, and had to be within a mile from where i was standing. the craft moved rapidly down, and abruptly stopped still above a tree line. it wasn't too far from the ground when it stopped, probabley 50' above the trees. the aircraft then flashed slightly brighter, and disappeared. no noise. no trail. it vanished.
content.summary: A brightly lit craft descends rapidly, and disappears.

content.detailedDescription: She was in windfall, looking west which would put the object at approx just south of s.R. 26 and west of u.S. 31 in kokomo, in  the time was 10:45 p.M.  weather was clear and cool.  she observed a large, bright object with what appeared to be multi-colored lights radiating ffrom it.  directly above it was more lights in a "wedge" or "triangular" shape. she also observed several orange-ish balls of light that seemed to move all over the sky.  she said they were doing strange, unnatural movements that no flares or planes could do.  they also darted all around the larger object.  the large light moved up a little higher, then came back down.  she said it was pretty low in the sky.  there was no sound. she observed this object for approx 5 minutes before she arrived at her destination.
content.summary: Bright object with mulit colored lights and a triangular or wedge shaped object below it.

content.detailedDescription: Noticed it from my back yard prior to leaving for work.  this is not the first instance i have noticed this same display.  i live between three airports....I know what a plane looks like....This was not a plane, or helicopter. i have no doubt that it is supposed to be written off as a star, but at the time of day( daybreak )......This is far to bright.  on my way to work......Gone.
content.summary: Stationary - far brighter than star - flash with red light circling flash.

content.detailedDescription:
around 3 p.M. on  january 3rd i was in downtown silver spring.  i stopped to photograph what i thought was a unusually dense collection of contrails.  i used an iphone camera.  i no longer think them to be  odd, though, as all these contrails are headed toward dulles airport. duh.  
     however, upon inspecting the photograph i noticed a black object that i had not noticed while taking the picture.  the resolution isn't great, but zooming in on the object located in upper right hand corner, it appears to be two spheres with some indication of exhaust or disturbance to its lower left.  as one can tell, the day was extraordinarily sunny.  the object has no reflection and it certainly does not appear to be a bird.  
     i'm sure the exact time was noted on the photo file, but i just got the iphone and don't know how to access that info.
content.summary: Attached photograph.

content.detailedDescription:
While taking our scheduled smoke break at the manufacturing plant where i
work, i and two co-workers always sit in a row facing west in an open overhead doorway. i think we all spotted it at the same time, and i was the first to say, " what in the hell is that?"  it only lasted for a few seconds, but it was unmistakable what we saw: 3 extremely bright red lights at about a 45 degree from each other in a straight line.  i would estimate the distance from us at about one mile or less.  the size of the
solid red lights would be about the same as if you held an eraser on the end of a pencil at arms length. the lights did not pulsate or move in any direction, but vanished as if turning out a light at a switch. one of the other guys said that it was probably a plane, being that our plant is next to the local airport. planes have one red, one green and one pulsating strobe light on them.  i've been around airplanes all my life, living close to the airport myself and also in the u.S. air force.  trust me, this was not a plane, nor helicopter. i only wish it would have lasted longer for observation purposes. i'm not sure what we saw, but it was kind of spooky.  the most spooky thing about it was the fact that the lights just blinked out (gone) in a nano-second. no sound was heard either. i would estimate that the lights were at about a 20 degree angle from the horizon.
content.summary: 3 bright red solid circles, motionless at about 20 degree angle from horizon , at  a 45 degree angle.

content.detailedDescription: On 31 december 2008 at 2350 i was outside with 3 teenagers observing fireworks being set off around our neighborhood...On of the young men in the group glanced off to the east,,,(we were facing south)and said,,whats that light? i turned and looked in the direction indicated,,and observed a large orange light,,traveling to the southwest, at a steady speed and with no observable changes in direction...I am an airline employee, and am used to seeing a/c landing lights, but i have never seen an orange landing light before on any civil aircraft....There was no sound,,yet the light did not seem to be traveling fast..I could not judge the distance, however,,it did appear to be about 40 degrees above the horizon,,easily visible over two story houses....Light seemed to flare up,,(increase in size) and then decrease in size at a regular interval...Light disappeared on the western horizon,,,seemed to be descending...My first reaction to the sighting,,,,an aircraft or helicopter,,,however,i could see no running lights, nav lights... during the sighting,,i glanced down the street and saw some of our neighbors,,another group of at least 6 people observing the same light..After the light disappeared,,i walked down to them to ask them what they saw,,and they also felt this was not an a/c or helicopter...My son and i went back into our house,,and he proceeded to investigate "orange light" sightings on youtube...Some of the videos do look like what we saw...We reported the light to the national ufo reporting center that evening,,
content.summary: Orange light observed traveling sw--no sound, appeared to descend.

content.detailedDescription: It was new years and i wanted to get some pictures of fireworks for my 8 yr old duaghter tai.I had turned of the porch light so i could get better pictures of the fireworks,but it was hard for me to see the switch on my camera,as i was messing with the switch the firewporks stoped poping ang i looked up, when i did i noticed three orange orbs flying slowly in a northen direction there was no sound i relized what i was seeing and screamed for my wife and duaghter they came and i remembered that i had a video setting on the camera thats when i started video taping i have 4 different vidoes from that night.We counted thirteen flying orbs the never stoped they just kind of slowly flew they started on one side of the sky and went completly across it, i then called my mom,and friend corey blanchard.Corey was in town and was able to see one from the side and said they looked to be 3000 to 5000 feet high,but that would mean that the size of those things was huge ,i thought they was about 500 to 1000 feet high,my wife got in touch wife my mother and sister inlaw they also seen them,they started to slowly stop coming they would start on one harizon and fly to the other as they stop showing up i went inside and started watching my videos but my nefwew stayed up at my moms house who lives north of me and got  some vidoe also and a still picture of them making a tryangle.It was the most amazing thing i have ever saw.I have one really good one of two over the lights in the subdivision. the camera i was useing is not a video taping unit its a digetal camera with video option
content.summary: A round orb that was orange and glowing, it was glowing, kind of like a throbbing.

content.detailedDescription: I was traveling south on 350 e, headed toward s.R. 26, on my way to sharpsville, to visit a friend, when a bright bright orange sparkly light in the western sky, south of kokomo, caught my eye.  i pulled off to the side of the road for a few minutes and watched it.  it appeared to be hanging right over another friends house, who lives at approx. 700 w and 300 n in tipton county.  it appeared to be below approximately 2500 feet in elevation, at about a 30% angle from the horizon.  it was very bright.  brighter that even any landing lights i have see aimed directly at me.  i immediately knew this wasn't a conventional aircraft. the light was a distinct orange color.  there was a large chevron shaped object directly above the obol.  i mean they could almost touch they were so close.  and there were "rays" for lack of a better description, radiating from the chevron to the obol.  it was really fantastic to see. i watched for approx 5 minutes.  it never moved.  it didn't go up, or down or come closer to me or retreat from me.  i finally decided i had to get to my original destination so i left.  when i returned to the area a few hours later, it was gone.  there was no sound to the craft at all.  weather conditions were as follows: 24��� (-4��� c), wind e 10mph barometer 30.04, dewpoint 16��� (-9���c), wind chill 15��� (-9���c) visibility 10.0 miles.  the crescent waning moon was just above the area of the sighting in the western sky at about a 45 degree angle from the horizon.  it was partially hazed over with a high altitude skud deck that was moving in. i felt very excited when i saw this.  my first instict was that this was not anything conventional nor was it any known celestial object.  the color was that distinct obol orange from march and april of last year.  there is nothing in the sky that color.
content.summary: Bright orange obol with orange chevron above it radiating beams and pulsating.

content.detailedDescription:
I had a sighting this morning, from (my spot) the corner of the front yard.  i was taking lucy out for morning constitutional, and we were in the area where that little walnut tree stands in the pasture just north of our property and i looked at the sky (like every morning.)

weather conditions:  24��������� (-4��������� c), wind e 10mph barometer 30.04, dewpoint 16��������� (-9���������c), wind chill 15��������� (-9���������c) visibility 10.0 miles

the object stayed in one place, ene of my exact position where i was standing (latitude 40.44397 longitude -86.06995).  i saw it for 4-5 minutes, starting at 7am edt.  it never moved.  it appeared to be a large, bright orange light, with a chevron of orange light just above it.  the chevron gave off a pulsing characteristic, as the rays in the chevron varied in length away from the peak.

it was by far the largest and brightest object in the sky.  i kept looking for aircraft lights, blinking, or for the object to turn which would indicate normal aircraft.  that didn't happen.  no additional lighting.  the light remained orange, below, and the chevron rays above it.  this was different than scintillation effect of celestial objects!

this was at least a half hour before any dawn light rose on the eastern horizon.  the sky was still completely black.  the (crescent waning moon had set long ago), so there was no celestial light pollution/distortion.

the object simply disappeared in the same spot.  it never grew in size or shrank in size, indicating it never came closer or moved away from my position the entire time i viewed it.

no sound.  i would put the object in the vicinity of kempton from the place i viewed it.  it was the size and light magnitude of jupiter (last night) at the brightest point when the moon was up (extremely bright last night).

i woke my wife at 7:25 am this morning. she had driven to her friends in sharpesville last night and returned home after i already gone to bed.

i immediately told her what i saw and gave her the description of what i saw.  she said she saw the exact same thing hovering in the western sky, slightly south of kokomo at 8:57pm. (she didn't tell me last night because i was asleep when she returned home.) 

thick clouds have moved in (7:45am) as i write this except for a clear ridge alondg the ene horizon.  the clearing is about 20��������� above the horizon (now), but the sky was completely clear and stars were plainly visible in every direction when i saw the object.
content.summary: Bright orange obol with orange chevron above it radiating beams and pulsating.

content.detailedDescription:
I was rudely awakened by my cat around 3 am and i couldn't get back to sleep.
just before 5 am, i remembered that the quadrantids meteor shower would be taking place so i decided to go out for a smoke and see if i could see any meteors. i stood outside, facing north, taking notice of how the constellations had "moved" since before i had gone to bed. the big dipper was pretty much right over my head. then i realized that one of the stars was moving. it was very small (as if you looked up at the stars and picked the dimmest one you could find) and it moved from just to the left of the north star in a due south direction. it was very slow and did not make a sound. as i stood there watching it, i glanced down for a second to re-adjust my stance as i was standing on uneven ground and when i looked back up it had changed direction and was now moving due east. i watched it for a few more minutes and it disappeared in the "handle" of the big dipper. my initial thought was a meteor, but i have seen meteors before and just as i was losing sight of this object is when i started to see the actual meteors. i counted 15 in all. there was no comparison in that this was very tiny, steady and had no tail...Plus you cant watch a meteor for that length of time.
my next thought was satellite- and although i had never seen one, i went back inside, turned on my computer and went to nasa's skywatch to find that lo and behold the iss would be visible, but not until 6:14 am. went back outside at 6:13 and watched the iss arc across the sky. the iss was markedly brighter and faster than what i saw. the fact that this thing was so tiny suggested an altitude that was entirely to high for a plane.
content.summary: Tiny star-like, steady, slow moving and changed direction, then dissapeared.

content.detailedDescription: During my morning routine i drink my coffee and smoke acigarette or two on my rear deck at home. i always watch the sky for shooting stars and satellites and generally admire the stars. on clear nights here in western maine we have an outstanding view of the stars. at first it appeared to be a star in the distance rapdily flashing white and trailing what looked like 2 orange tentacles of light. i watched it for a few minutes and then saw it move and thought, what the heck is that. it would move occasionally in rounded sweeping movements and i saw it move in a 90 degree movement downward and to a sudden stop. the best description i can give is that with the naked eye it moves alot like a kite would up up the sky. i took a couple pictures but it was too dark and the object is too distant. it appears like it is up over quebec somewhere. when i got my binoculars to look at it i was astonished. at many points it looks like a 2 disc craft with a central core connecting the two discs, mostly green halo surround the entire craft and rapidly flashing white light around the top disc with random bright reds flashing in the white area, on the bottom disc it is mostly orange and green lights, no red flashing in this area. when it moves (watching with binoculars) it spins rapidly almost like looking at a laser pointer being moved around a white screen. looping and spinning almost like my hands were shaking. so i stabilized the binocs and sure enough, it was not me. it rapidly circles when it moves then suddenly stops. i just went out to look and watch again for a few minutes before writing this line and it is still there even though the sky is brightening for dawn. one thing to note is there is an extraordinary number of shooting stars this morning, i have personally seen 16 so far. this object is not a plane, if fact one flew by in the general sky area, not too closely, i watched it approach and fly by and i have to believe they had to see this object, it is certainly bright enough and large enough. it is now somewhat lower on the northern horizon and more difficult to see. i did wake my wife at 5:30 to come out and look with me to confirm i am not crazy. she also sees it and because it is cold outside she went into the bedroom and watched from the window. i did too for a short time but the screen makes it less clear to see details. i am exhilarated by this experience and wanted to share it with somebody who would not think i am insane. one hour now and it is still there but into the trees now that it is so much lower on the horizon.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Hovering and moving in nw sky right now, been watching for 30+ minutes.

content.detailedDescription:
In june 1977, a friend and i drove to a beer party in millcreek, pa. millcreek is a township just outside erie. technically, it is erie, but it's out in the sticks a bit more. erie as in erie, pa- situated on one of the ���great lakes���. when we got to the party, all the beer was gone- this was strange since it was not quite 9pm on a friday night. this wasn���t the only thing ���strange��� that would happen that night. in any event, we left party w/a couple of friends and went to bar where "minors" could buy beer- we were all 18 and 19 respectively. after buying a six-pack of beer, we drove to an area close to the kahkwa club (i knew this area because my family belonged to the club) where semi-new development, houses, were being phased in. we parked alongside a road that lead into the partially-completed development. it was dark out that night but not that dark, so we could see our surroundings clearly. 

as i popped the top off my beer (pull-tabs back then), i happened to look straight ahead to my left- something caught my eye. what i very clearly saw, 300-400ft away, i couldn't believe: it was a whitish disc (saucer-shaped) hovering above a house. by "hovering above a house", i mean like almost sitting on it- just right above. i would estimate 50-75ft above roof of house. the disc was smooth and was roughly the size of the house (if not a bit bigger���maybe 1.5 times as large), which was a decent-sized, upper-scale, two-story house. i remember thinking: "these people in the house should still be awake at this hour." i thought also that maybe the saucer was "picking up" people from the house. i couldn't believe it was that close to the house- just sitting/hovering above it like that. surreal. 

in any event, the saucer was very clearly seen- it had a ring of lights, decent-sized and yellow or standard light color, which rotated or appeared to rotate clock-wise, based on which one lit up as the craft was stationary/hovering. these lights became brighter as the ���spinning��� effect (of the lights only- the craft itself remained ���motionless���) accelerated. there was no noise associated w/the disc. i watched this for about 30-40 seconds- the instant i thought to tell my buddy: "hey, look at that!", the saucer tilted as if on an invisible axis (it had been on a flat, stationary plane as it paralleled the roof of the house) and the lights started to get brighter and "spin" or rotate around at an increased speed. the lights were above the base of the ship, located midway on the disc/saucer- there was a portion of the saucer that was above the lights. so, as soon as i started to tell my friend, who was too busy/distracted opening his beer, the thing tilted on its side and took off. it moved very quickly, yet with no sound- it was if the saucer/disc was sucked up via a vacuum, like it ���displaced��� gravity. i believe it did. by this, i mean the visual image/representation (what i saw) of the saucer shrank very quickly as it moved upward. the rate it moved upward was nothing short of amazing, so the image quickly became smaller at a quick rate- this was interesting in that the image itself appeared to exhibit just a slight ���lag��� time as the craft moved away. most interesting- i have never seen anything move that quickly.  within a few seconds after i thought to tell my friend, the thing was gone. while it moved upward, it did not move laterally- that is what i mean when i say that it moved upward as if sucked up in a vacuum- everything was constant in terms of its position except the increased height. again, i have never seen anything move like this- extremely precise. to reiterate: it moved as if gravity was simply ���displaced��� around it. 

this was a very close encounter, and the sense i got was that whoever/whatever was piloting the craft did not want people to be aware of it- so it fled. i also know that we must have initiated heat-based signature-awareness obvious to whatever was controlling that craft. i also believe that it (they���whatever was controlling the saucer) was able to pick up on the fact that i saw it (my thought patterns) and that i was in process of conveying that information to my friend. when people think, energy changes and is more visible with the right type of vision. in any event, my thoughts corresponded to the movement or actions of the saucer.

during the following week...After this ocurred...I was very tempted to drive back out there and knock on the door of that house to see what the people who lived there were like...Do a quick cursory to see if i noticed anything strange. i decided against that because i thought that this was, in fact, not a good/safe thing to do... but i kept my eyes open to see if any disappearances were reported in that area via the paper or the nightly news. i very-much thought that would be the case. i wonder how many people have seen a saucer sitting, hovering in the air, just above a house like that. 

what i have reported is the absolute truth- the saucer was unmistakably clear. if we had had cell phones w/cameras back then, i could have snapped one heck of a shot. so, this is what i saw back in the summer of 1977, as an 18-year old, in erie, pa.  

a funny thing i just noticed as i write this description/report- it���s as if the memory wants to take off- just like the saucer did- i noticed this as i started to write. very strange. another thing: when we returned to the party, we were greeted with: ���you guys were gone a long time.��� when i looked at my watch, i realized that it was a bit after 11pm. did't seem that long. to this day, i can still very tangibly feel the instant that the saucer/disc took off- that part is very resident.

this probably has nothing to do w/anything- but it���s interesting- my father was part of the apollo project in the late ���60s, so i have seen first-hand up-close pictures of some aspects of that project- what i saw that night in erie was much more advanced- the technology was not even close.
content.summary: Saucer hovering over house.

content.detailedDescription:
While driving south on interstate 65, a bright light in the sky appeared off to the left and up from the horizon about 25 degrees. the light was very distinct and vivid against the clear blue sky and no more than a mile away.  it appeared to be hovering or just stationary. there was no movement for at least 4 to 5 minutes before it accelerated incredibly fast to the south, where it suddenly made a 45 degree turn toward the east.  it disappeared below the horizon.
the light was constant, there was no flashing or change of color. i will be real surprised if no one else saw this event. there was heavy traffic on the highway and a busy airport in the vicinity.
i do not know what it was
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: White light object appears in the sky and speeds away.

content.detailedDescription: My son, husband and i were in the back yard looking for meteors. this one round,about the size of a softball or cabbage,  bright yellow glowing, (with a strobing light) object came through the ne corner of our backyard, silently flew through the yard diagonally and turned west at  the corner of our house and flew beside our home. it was only 8-10 feet off of the ground. we were so dumbfounded that we all just stood there and didn't say anything for a bit. sadly and regrettably, we didn't follow it. i would have thought i was nuts if my husband and son hadn't seenit too. it was definitely not a meteor....It was too low....It flew slowly and was low too the ground and the light blinked ot strobed slowly and methodically...Not eratically. my son was 14 , my husband is co-manager of a local grocery and i am a church secretary.This was at 414 s. race st. we have since moved, but still own the property at present.We were afraid to say anything sooner, even now , fearly others will think we are nuts.
content.summary: My son, husband and i were in the back yard looking for meteors. this one round, about the size of a softball or cabbage, bright yellow glowing, (with a strobing light) object came through the ne corner of our backyard, silently flew through the yard diag

content.detailedDescription: We were on the beach @ a wake, about 4-5 am, everyone else went to bed, we were waiting for the fire to dieout , and watching the ocean and talking when we spotted a strange light across the inlet where there was no platforms , when we began discussing the event, it suddenly flashed a bright red/white light and shot off shortly dissapering.
content.summary: Strange light across the inlet, moving fast, stopped and flashed bright red then took off really quickly ,dissapeared after a few seconds.

content.detailedDescription: While driving in swansea, ma i spotted a very bright yellow circular light in the sky and it caught my attention. it was located in fround of me. it then quickly moved to the left of my car and the bright light was shut off, when the bright light was off i noticed 3 smaller lights in a row. the craft then quickly moved to the right side of the street and hovered there for a while. i kept my eye on it until i lost it for 2 seconds while driving past a tall tree. once past the tree the object was gone completely. no sight of it at all. the whole time i was baffled as to what it could be moving in such an odd pattern and with such odd lights.
content.summary: Bright light, moved from center, to left 3 smaller lights no bright light, to right, hovered, dissapeared.

content.detailedDescription:
I have a street wire to position the brilliant orb. it bobs in relation to the wire. i am able to see 4 white, round lights across while several other lights blink red, green and yellow. it looks "snakelike" when i stare too long because of the way it is moving. it appears to be south and slightly to the west if my directions are right. (looking past where the airplanes come and go.) this thing has been in the same general area for hours in the evening, not every night. however, i have seen it 3 times this past week. i go back hours later and do not see it there anymore. (i was sitting in my living room watching tv. you can see it through my sliding glass doors.)

airplanes come and go from an airport between me and it. i can see the airplanes very clearly with my binoculars while the orb bobs in place - blinking. it's not an airplane. it could be a satellite or the space station. i don't know. if it was either, why is it usually gone around 9:30-10:30 pm?

back in may or june 2008, i saw 5 orbs very similar to it positioned in the sky more to the north then east. (just outside of my house) i ran in to get my cousin; the way they glided into place and then bobbed was fascinating. by the time we got back out, only 3 were still there. one was positioned over some trees and we watched it bob there. i went back later and all 3 were gone. (i had been walking my dogs.)

this past week there was this one in almost the same place (a little more to the left and up over the wires). a second more erratic one with very bright/fast white blinking with intermittent red, green and yellow. i couldn't keep focus on it. sometimes it just disappeared and then reappeared in the same general area to the side of some trees. (i was standing on my porch just outside the sliding glass doors.)

i never hear anything. it's all visual. every time i see it i feel intrigue and want to share it with others. i think this is a ufo but wonder why airplanes aren't chasing it and why it keeps popping up in the same general area time and time again. if i had a good camera, i would take pictures. it's far away so a cell phone or regular camera just wouldn't do it justice.
content.summary: It bobs in the same spot with flashes of red, green and yellow. just stays in the same general area, blinking lights

content.detailedDescription: my family was camping on the bow river outside calgary alberta for the weekend. it was late in the evening and we were sitting by the fire and i happened to look up at the sky and saw a long shiny triangle shaped object crossing the sky at what seemed a slow rate of speed. the object seemed to stop and go again and rapidly changed course seeming to stop and jog sideways and then go forward again. i pointed it out to my father and he said it was a weather balloon but i said if it was it was going against the wind because the wider end was on the eastern side and the narrow end was on the western side and it was traveling east to west. it was also high enough in the sky to reflect sunlight and the sun had gone down an hour or so prior to the sighting and it was dark enough to see the stars clearly. the object shone as bright as a very bright star or planet and was very large or i would have thought it was just an aircraft. as i said it was high enough to reflect sunlight. it was clearly visible as a triangular object that was elongated to the point of seeming like a stretched out teardrop and went from one side of the sky to the other in about one hour or so. thank you wade nickerson
content.summary: Elongated triangle traveling east to west very high in the night sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Date of sighting: september 15, 2004    
time: 5:00 p.M.

location of sighting: charlotte, nc. 
number of witnesses: 1 +   
number of objects: 1 
shape of objects: rectangle ufo, approximately size of tennis court.

full description of event/sighting: 

i was driving in 5 o'clock traffic on i-85 in north charlotte, nc towards unc-charlotte campus. i was taking an exit ramp towards the university when i looked up in front of me about 150 yards away a rectangular shaped object was floating silently above the tree line. at first i thought it must be a banner being pulled by a plane but i quickly realized that wasn't the case. it was as large as a tennis court. the object was covered with encased reflective panels that were dark army green and may have been reflecting the trees below.

i drove slowly and watched it in utter amazement for about 15 seconds. i had time to take off my sunglasses to make sure of what i was seeing. as the traffic crept down the road the ufo floated behind a tree line and i couldn't see it anymore. i didn't even think to look at other drivers to see if they reacted to it. 

as i got closer to the campus, i noticed two cars that were pulled off the road. i was kind of in a daze and was locked in with the rest of traffic so had to keep going. 

i've researched rectangle shaped ufo reports and find many similarities such as most witnesses having the initial reaction that it must be a banner being pulled by an airplane. in fact, another rectangle ufo was reported in charlotte, nc in september 2008, in the same area of town. seeing this object did change my life in that i know for certain now that ufo's are real and they can do anything.
content.summary: Rectangle ufo approximately the size of a tennis court.

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were on our way back home from a night at his family's house. we were taking our normal route home on hwy 169 south. it was approximately midnight when we noticed a light off in the distance. apparently we both noticed it at the same time, but did not know that until later. i saw it and said nothing. my husband noticed it and watched it for awhile before asking me if i saw it as well. once we realized we were seeing the same thing, we immediately looked for a rational reason to explain the odd light. *let me make a quick note. my husband is a staunch skeptic and i want to believe with the right evidence. this is important since it was my husband who actually commented first about the object instead of myself. i had noticed the object and simply not said anything because typically he shrugs off things such as this.  initially a plane was the obvious answer, but we noticed as we got closer to the object, it did not seem to be moving. we were drawing closer in the car going approximately 65mph and it was staying perfectly stationary.  we then reasoned, perhaps it was a tower with a light to warn planes approaching, but then we realized that was not possible. we  confirmed that by driving the same route the next night and there is no light in the same area. again, we ran through every reasonable scenario in our head and came up with nothing that matched what we saw. the object was triangular in shape with six points of light underneath it. five of the lights were white with the one in the center on the underneath side being red.  since we were traveling on the highway at a decent speed, we were upon the object quicker than i anticipated. i finally got over the shock of what i was seeing and reached for my cell phone camera. i took one very horrid picture that is not worth passing on. it was distant and extremely blurred since we were traveling quickly. about this time the highway veers towards the east, away from the object. we planned on taking the next exit off and backtracking. as i turned towards the back of the car to keep my eye on it, it seemed to simply dissappear. i could not say whether it accelerate so quickly that my eyes could not take in the experience quickly enough, or if it truly vanished into thin air, but it was no longer in view at all within a second. let me note here that my husband believes it took off towards the west. we continued to talk about the event the rest of the way home. it seemed to go by so quickly and yet in slow motion at the same time. to this day, we have found no one else that has reported seeing an object on that evening and have no answers about what it could have been.
content.summary: Witnessed stationary, triangular object in the tulsa night sky.
